bill.title: Relating To Resiliency.
bill.description: Directs the Public Utilities Commission to establish a microgrid services tariff to encourage and facilitate the development and use of energy resilient microgrids. Takes effect on 7/1/2018. (SD2)

history.action: Pending introduction.
Introduced and Pass First Reading.
Referred to EEP, CPC, FIN, referral sheet 7
Bill scheduled to be heard by EEP on Tuesday, 01-30-18 8:30AM in House conference room 325.

The committees on EEP recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 8 Ayes: Representative(s) C. Lee, Lowen, Cullen, Kong, McKelvey, Todd, Yamane, McDermott; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from EEP (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 147-18) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to CPC.
Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on CPC with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Quinlan, Tupola excused (2).
Bill scheduled to be heard by CPC on Tuesday, 02-13-18 2:00PM in House conference room 329.

The committees on CPC recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 10 Ayes: Representative(s) Takumi, Ichiyama, Aquino, Ito, LoPresti, Mizuno, Say, Tokioka, Yamane, McDermott; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Johanson.
Reported from CPC (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 542-18) as amended in HD 2, recommending referral to FIN.

Report adopted. referred to the committee(s) on FIN as amended in HD 2 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) DeCoite, Ing, Nakamura, Onishi, Woodson excused (5).
Bill scheduled to be heard by FIN on Friday, 02-23-18 2:00PM in House conference room 308.

The committees on FIN recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 11 Ayes: Representative(s) Luke, Cullen, Cachola, Fukumoto, Gates, Holt, Keohokalole, Kobayashi, Nakamura, Yamashita, Ward; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 4 Excused: Representative(s) DeCoite, Lowen, Todd, Tupola.
Reported from FIN (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 822-18), recommending passage on Third Reading.
Passed Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) McKelvey, Yamane excused (2). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 73).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to CPH/TRE, WAM.
Re-Referred to TRE/CPH, WAM.
The committee(s) on TRE/CPH has scheduled a public hearing on 03-19-18 3:15PM in conference room 225.

The committee(s) on CPH recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in CPH were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Baker, Tokuda, Espero, Ihara, Nishihara; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) S. Chang, Ruderman.

The committee(s) on TRE recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in TRE were as follows: 3 Aye(s): Senator(s) Inouye, Espero, Shimabukuro; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) English, Harimoto.
Reported from TRE/CPH (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3145) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referral to WAM.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and referred to WAM.
The committee(s) on WAM will hold a public decision making on 04-05-18 10:30AM in conference room 211.

The committee(s) on WAM recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in WAM were as follows: 9 Aye(s): Senator(s) Dela Cruz, Keith-Agaran, English, Galuteria, K. Kahele, Kidani, Riviere, Shimabukuro, Wakai; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Harimoto, Inouye.
Reported from WAM (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3603) with recommendation of passage on Third Reading, as amended (SD 2).
48 Hrs. Notice 04-10-18.
Report adopted; Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 2). Ayes, 24; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 1 (Senator(s) Harimoto). Transmitted to House.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 667) in amended form (SD 2).
House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).
Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 608).
House Conferees Appointed: C. Lee, Takumi, Lowen Co-Chairs; Quinlan, McDermott.
Received notice of appointment of House conferees (Hse. Com. No. 609).
House Conferee(s) discharged.
Reconsideration of action taken on 04-12-18.
Received notice of change in conferees (Hse. Com. No. 700).
Received notice of House reconsideration of action in disagreeing to the amendments proposed by the Senate (Hse. Com. No. 702).
House agrees to Senate amendment(s).
Passed Final Reading as amended in SD 2 with Representative(s) DeCoite, Onishi, San Buenaventura voting aye with reservations; Representative(s) Har, Tokioka voting no (2) and none excused (0).
Received notice of House agreement and passage on Final Reading (Hse. Com. No. 706).
Transmitted to Governor.
